Description: Body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup, possibly a cup with everted rim; interior glazed black; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of diagnostic features makes it impossible to definitively identify the sherd. If it does belong to a South Ionian cup with everted rim, then based on the decoration and fabric, it might be placed with Schlotzhauer's (Schlotzhauer 2012) South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9. Type 9 cups have been found in large numbers at in other sanctuary settings including at the Sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus. This type was the most common type of South Ionian cups with everted rims found at Naukratis. The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 286)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 667, no. 247)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.624) (Phase 3)
